All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
AbstractDevice<T extends AbstractDeviceListener>
The abstract base class for all devices from Jimmy's Electronics.
AbstractDeviceListener
This class represents the abstract interface for all device listeners.
Barcode
Represents a barcode value (not the graphic barcode itself).
BarcodedItem
Represents items for sale, each with a particular barcode and weight.
BarcodedProduct
Represents products with barcodes.
BarcodeScanner
A complex device hidden behind a simple simulation.
BarcodeScannerListener
Listens for events emanating from a barcode scanner.
BlockedCardException
Represents exceptions arising from a blocked card.
Card
Represents plastic cards (e.g., credit cards, debit cards, membership cards).
Card.CardData
The abstract base type of card data.
CardIssuer
Represents external companies that issue cards and authorize payments made with them.
CardReader
Represents the card reader, capable of tap, chip insert, and swipe.
CardReaderListener
Listens for events emanating from a coin dispenser.
ChipFailureException
Represents exceptions arising from failures of the chip.
Customer
Represents the simulation of a customer, capable of interacting with the hardware.
DoItYourselfStation
Represents the overall DIY self-checkout station.
ElectronicScale
Represents electronic scales on which can be placed one or more items.
ElectronicScaleListener
Listens for events emanating from an electronic scale.
IllegalDigitException
Signals that an illegal character has been used where a digit (0-9) was expected.
InvalidArgumentSimulationException
An exception that can be raised when an invalid argument is passed inside the simulation.
InvalidPINException
Represents exceptions arising from entry of an invalid PIN.
Item
Abstract base class of items for sale, each with a particular weight.
MagneticStripeFailureException
Represents exceptions arising from failures of the magnetic stripe.
NoPowerException
Signals that there was an attempt to use a device that was not turned on.
NullPointerSimulationException
An exception that can be raised when a null pointer is passed inside the simulation.
Numeral
Represents numerals (i.e., number characters) referred to as "Arabic numbers" in English.
OverloadException
Represents situations where a device has been overloaded, in terms of weight, quantity of items, etc.
PowerGrid
Represents the electrical power grid as a Singleton.
PowerSurge
Simulates a power surge.
Product
Abstract base class for products.
ProductDatabases
Represents a cheap and dirty version of a set of databases that the simulation can interact with.
SampleBarcodeScannerDemo
This is a sample class that demonstrates how to interact with a BarcodeScanner, registering instances of SampleBarcodeScannerListener on it and checking that they have recorded the correct information.
SampleBarcodeScannerListener
This is a sample of how one could create a class to listen for events emanating from a barcode scanner.
SimulationException
An exception that can be raised when the behaviour within the simulator makes no sense, typically when it has not been configured correctly.
TapFailureException
Represents exceptions arising from failures of taps.
TouchScreen
A device for display and customer input.
TouchScreenListener
Listens for enable/disable events on touch screens.
Wallet
Simple representation of a customer's wallet.
